description: iterator; used to succinctly define multiple similar items
remarks: individual iterators of the `i` array are referrable by their indexed variable counterparts `i1`, `i2`, etc.; iterators are hierarchical with `i1` being at the top ("for every `i1` do {for every `i2` do {...}}"); an arbitrary number of iterators can be used
besides the language subkeys, an `.int` subkey must be provided holding *integer* value codes; an optional `.targets` subkey holds the values' individual target respondent group `id`s

description: whether answering the item is mandatory or can be skipped
whether or not giving multiple answers to the item's question is allowed
